org.cyclops.cyclopscore.tileentity

Class CyclopsTileEntity

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.minecraftforge.common.capabilities.CapabilityProvider<net.minecraft.tileentity.TileEntity>
      • net.minecraft.tileentity.TileEntity
        • org.cyclops.cyclopscore.tileentity.CyclopsTileEntity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    net.minecraftforge.common.capabilities.ICapabilityProvider, net.minecraftforge.common.capabilities.ICapabilitySerializable<net.minecraft.nbt.CompoundNBT>, net.minecraftforge.common.extensions.IForgeTileEntity, net.minecraftforge.common.util.INBTSerializable<net.minecraft.nbt.CompoundNBT>, IDirtyMarkListener, INBTProvider

    public class CyclopsTileEntity
extends net.minecraft.tileentity.TileEntity
implements INBTProvider, IDirtyMarkListener
    A base class for all the tile entities. If you want this tile to update, just implement CyclopsTileEntity.ITickingTile. This class has an anti-lag mechanism to send updates with sendUpdate(). Every instance has a continuously looping counter that counts from getUpdateBackoffTicks() to zero. and every time the counter reaches zero, the backoff will be reset and an update packet will be sent if one has been queued.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  CyclopsTileEntity.ITickingTile
      Apply this interface on any tile classes that should tick.
      static class  CyclopsTileEntity.TickingTileComponent
      Component to be used together with the Delegate annotation to enable tile ticking.

    • Method Detail

      • isTicking

        protected boolean isTicking()

      • sendUpdate

        public final void sendUpdate()
        Send a world update for the coordinates of this tile entity. This will always send lag-safe updates, so calling this many times per tick will not cause multiple packets to be sent, more info in the class javadoc.

      • sendImmediateUpdate

        public final void sendImmediateUpdate()
        Send an immediate world update for the coordinates of this tile entity. This does the same as sendUpdate() but will ignore the update backoff.

      • updateTileEntity

        protected void updateTileEntity()
        Override this method instead of updateTicking(). This method is called each tick.

      • onSendUpdate

        protected void onSendUpdate()
        Called when an update will is sent. This contains the logic to send the update, so make sure to call the super!

      • beforeSendUpdate

        protected void beforeSendUpdate()
        Called when before update is sent.

      • afterSendUpdate

        protected void afterSendUpdate()
        Called when after update is sent. (Not necessarily received yet!)

      • onUpdateReceived

        public void onUpdateReceived()
        This method is called when the tile entity receives an update (ie a data packet) from the server. If this tile entity uses NBT, then the NBT will have already been updated when this method is called.

      • getUpdateBackoffTicks

        protected int getUpdateBackoffTicks()
        Returns:
        The minimum amount of ticks between two consecutive sent packets.
